title: I've got a few questions regarding backlogs and their consequences.
content:
I had a few queries regarding backlogs and I wanted to get them clarified:

1. If one gets a backlog in a 4/5 credit course. How many marks should they score in their backlog exams to pass, is it 40/100? Some say its 80/100.  
2. I've heard if someone gets a backlog in an exam in any semester, they're barred from availing fee scholarship in the subsequent semesters even after their backlog is cleared and they get the required SGPA. Is this true?

comments.body:
1. 40/100, to get an E.
2. I don't think so, but you should confirm with someone else. But I am sure that if you have an active backlog, you are ineligible for placements and scholarships (I think) until you clear it.

It's always 40/100

The reason for 2) is that it bring the sgpa down so you can not be eligible for scholarships
